name: Freewheelin' Meet-up

location.postalAddress: 837/1, 2nd Cross, 7th Main, 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka

description:
Join this bicycle ride to meet the community and explore the city with them! Enjoy Bengaluru's sights, sounds, tastes and aromas, without the din and pollution of its traffic. Wind down your ride with some fun conversations and savour the delicacies of your favourite (or to be favourite) eateries. 
Sunday - 8th Sep'24Starting time: 7:30 am @ Pedal in TandemRide distance approx. 20kms and head over to Brik Oven, Indiranagar, for breakfast
WHAT TO BRING:- Bicycle and helmet. Rentals are available at Pedal in Tandem.
{'DISTANCE': '15KM'}

name: Workshop - Drivetrains and Gear Ratios

location.postalAddress: 837/1, 2nd Cross, 7th Main, 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka
location.address: Pedal in Tandem bike shop in Indiranagar, Bangalore

description:
This session will help you understand how your bicycle's drivetrain (or "gears") work. You will learn about the configurations available for different types of bikes, how they translate to ride experience, and how you should choose the correct set of configurations for different types of riding, road surfaces and terrain. We'll explain various drivetrain components and cover concepts such as gear ratios/inches, gear range and cadence. This session is open to anyone who is keen to understand these concepts at least a little deeper than just "I have a '24-speed' bike", which is something you hear often but literally means nothing!Meeting time: 2:45 pmSession Duration: 2 hoursBlack coffee and snacks are on the house!
{}

name: The Games We Play - Badminton

location.postalAddress: 837/1, 2nd Cross, 7th Main, 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka
location.address: game theory at caurvery school, indiranagar

description:
Relive the joys of childhood games, and remember what it's like to not to take things too seriously, and just embrace the playful, spontaneous and carefree aspects of life. This one involves a few rounds of badminton while you get to meet and bond with members of the community.
Location: Game Theory at Caurvery School, Indiranagar - Time: 7 to 9 pm
If you don't have badminton shoes or rackets, you can rent them at the venue, from Game Theory.

name: Arkavathi Blues

location.postalAddress: 837/1, 2nd Cross, 7th Main, 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka

description:
The Arkavati is an important river in Karnataka, originating at Nandi Hills, north of Bangalore in the Chikkabalapur District, and flowing down south through Ramanagara and Kanakapura. It then joins the Kaveri river further south, at Sangama. It forms several waterfalls on its journey, some small, and some large like the Chunchi falls. The region around the southern leg of this river is forested, and either adjoins or is part of one these protected areas - Nandi State Forest, Bannerghatta National Park, Basavanabetta State Forest amd Cauvery Wildlife Sanctuary. Our routes skirt around these forests and pass through the many agricultural villages nestled between forest land. The Arkavathi and it's many shades of blue will be in view during several sections of the ride. This is a meticulously crafted adventure cycling tour that combines these elements perfectly - the scenic countryside route, a picnic breakfast, a buffet lunch after the ride, all the support you need during the ride, and a fun group of riders to keep you company from the incredible Pedal in Tandem community!

name: Tree walk

location.postalAddress: 837/1, 2nd Cross, 7th Main, 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka

description:
We often associate nature with travel, with forests and hill-stations and far-off places. But what if you could connect to nature here in the city?
 Join us for a relaxed walk through the shaded streets of Indiranagar.
 We'll look up at tree canopies, peer closely at barks and roots, listen to interesting anecdotes 
 and maybe rekindle our own memories of nature. All you need to bring is a cap, a water bottle and a curious mind.Distance: 1.5 to 2kmVenue: Defence Colony, IndiranagarTime: 8:00-10:00 amThis walk is facilitated by Suchi Govindarajan. Suchi is a writer, poet and photographer. She is the author of three wildlife-themed books for children. A Certified Nature Guide from The Naturalist School, Suchi believes that connecting to nature can make our lives more meaningful.
{}

name: Hennur Countryside

location.postalAddress: 837/1, 2nd Cross, 7th Main, 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka

description:
Join us on this ride to explore the pretty countryside in Hennur. Our route will take you through some of the most scenic parts of the region. From the meeting point, we'll head straight into a charming and rustic country road that'll give you a glimpse of local life as you cycle past small villages, farms, and fields. The route then goes beside the Hennur Bamboo forest, which is a beautiful stretch that offers a refreshing view of bamboo groves all around.
